solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= _{{(pi_val*((l*Decimal('0.5'))**2)*j)-(pi_val*(((l*Decimal('0.5'))-k)**2)*j)}}_ cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {_{l}_}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {_{l}_}{2} - _{m}_)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {_{l}_}2)^2-\pi (\frac {_{l}_}2 - m)^2}\)
= _{{ trunc( (pi_val*((l*Decimal('0.5'))**2)*j)-(pi_val*(((l*Decimal('0.5'))-k)**2)*j) / ((pi_val*((l*Decimal('0.5'))**2))-(pi_val*(((l*Decimal('0.5'))-m)**2))), 2) }}_ cm

content.text: A metallic tube, _{j}_ cm long, has a thickness of _{k}_ cm and an outer diameter of _{l}_ cm. It is melted and made into another tube of thickness _{m}_ cm with the same outer diameter. No material is wasted. What is the length of the new tube? (in cm)
